intro: Garnotia linearis, commonly known as the slender garnotia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring narrow, linear leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Garnotia linearis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
